column4: Hey, i've been searching on the net for a guide how to install wow (from CD's) with wine. But all the guides i've seen doesnt resemble anything like my wine. I followed one guide, that told me to go to Accerssories -> Wine File. But i dont have that. Can anyone help me?
The Applications Places System Menu. Under Applications is usually a category called Accessories for older Wine installs. Mine is under Wine Emulator.
I dont even have that
Is Wine installed even ?
Yes, i have under "Applications" a own Wine section. And from there i used to use Wine doors. But it wont let me install from my cd
Install what from CD?
Wow:P
Or anything else
Would it be wise to uninstall Wine and install it again?
Try browsing the CD and double-clicking the exe. :/ Wine should run it. :/
I don't see any probable change in Wine from reinstalling it.
Thats the problem, the WOW cd dont have a exe file>< it only have those installer tome.mpq
Are there any 'autorun.inf' files?
It should say to automatically run (Windows determines what to run in a CD via that file) what program.
When i use "Wine doors" and try "Install from CD" it wont even read the .mpq files=/
Wine Doors?
Yea, thats what it's called
Ok, scensis copy the contents of autorun.inf (or whatever, ls the drive, file list) into pastebin.
Wine Doors, never known it to go by that name.
Yea, ill use some time to figure out all of that since im a beginner at ubuntu:p
Well autorun.inf tells Windows what file to run. Opening it in gedit/text editor will show what file it runs (exe). Double-click (should execute with wine) the file and Wine will run it.
Ok, thanks. Will try to locate autorun.inf
